elements.title: ring theory (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Susan Silk developed ring theory (pictured) when a colleague said that Silk's breast cancer wasn't just about her?

elements.title: Lukáš Vondráček (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 2016, Lukáš Vondráček became the first Czech pianist to win the Queen Elisabeth Competition?

elements.title: the Henry Grady (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to Jimmy Carter, "more of [Georgia's] business was probably conducted in the Henry Grady than in the state capitol"?

elements.title: Freddy Mamani (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Freddy Mamani was motivated to become a teacher in part to help his parents overcome their illiteracy?

elements.title: a TV station in New York state (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a TV station in New York state signed on just to carry the 1953 World Series, then went off the air and did not start scheduled programming for several weeks?

elements.title: Isabel Fernández (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that journalist Isabel Fernández likened her experience as a correspondent during periods of intense civil unrest to "[being in] a lion's cage"?

elements.title: LAX Consolidated Rent-A-Car Facility (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the LAX Consolidated Rent-A-Car Facility is the second-largest concrete building in the U.S. – behind only the Pentagon?

elements.title: Keith Sheen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that educationalist Keith Sheen learned how to kill rats with a frying pan at his first job?
